item.title: By: Laurence O'Donnell
item.dc:creator: Laurence O'Donnell
item.description:
Hi Tim,
Glad you found the site!
For my two cents on where to begin in Bavinck's works, if you are just jumping in, you may enjoy starting with Bavinck's own summary of his 4 vol. Dogmatics, entitled, <em><a href="http://www.heritagebooks.org/products/Our-Reasonable-Faith.html" rel="nofollow">Our Reasonable Faith</a></em>. Another of his shorter works, <em><a href="http://www.archive.org/details/sacrificeofprais00bavi" rel="nofollow">The Sacrifice of Praise</a></em>, is freely available online, as is his <em><a href="http://books.google.com/books?id=wS03AAAAMAAJ&dq=bavinck%20philosophy%20of%20revelation&pg=PR3#v=onepage&q&f=false" rel="nofollow">Philosophy of Revelation</a></em>. If you already have vol. 2 and have already read sections 1-3, I'd continue on into the subsequent sections on creation and anthropology.
